instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
It's not starting up, But the fan is running, No chime, No display, or No backlight
Could someone please help me with the schematic and board view?

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I could find the 820-00281 schematic, As per this schematic and board file here is the voltage values 
All the readings are using the charger after disconnecting the battery connector. After disconnecting the battery it consumes a total 1.47Amp current at 19.7V.

L8410 - PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT - 0V
L7660 - PP3V3_S5 - 3.324V
L7600 - PP5V_S4 - 5.12V
L7900 - P1V2_PHASE - 1.205V
L7960 - PPVCCIO_S0_CPU - 0.978V
L8000 - PP1V_PCH_REG_R - 1.014V
L7030 - TBA_PHASE1 -12.68V
L7410 - PPVCCGT_CPU_PH1 - 0V
L7420 - PPVCCGT_CPU_PH2 - 0V
L7211 - PPVCC_CPU_PH1 - 1.045V
L7221 - PPVCC_CPU_PH2  - 0V
L7231 - PPVCC_CPU_PH3  - 1.047V
L7330 - PPVCCSA_CPU_R  - 1.052V
LA640 - PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2 - 0.903V
LA650 - GFXIMVP_PHASE1 -  0.903V
LA350 - VRVDDCI_R  - 0.902V

LA300 - PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG_R - 1.349V 

LB700 - P5VUSBCT_R - 0V

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
CPU core should drop from 1.05V to 0.6V aprox, when board really boots.
Did you try knwon good BIOS?
PLT_RESET_L comes high?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I have removed the board, it is 820-00928-A, I could see some areas are a little dirty and a bit corroded. Please find the video attached. Does anybody have a schematic and board view for this particular model?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1G3IAYy5MHZELmZ5BPY-4LleGXIGuQjGn?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I could find the schematic and board file, Sharing it in the same google drive above. 
The corrosion is around  U3900 (DDR4) , and U3100.

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
L7211/21/31 must all have the SAME voltage; check schematic.

Please reply the previous questions.

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
When I test board separately ,  L7211/21/31   all these voltages stays 0V.
Same time  PLT_RST_L stays HIGH (3.3V). CPU is heating UP (Heat is keep increasing)

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
You've said 1V at L7211/31; which is actually state?
PLT_RST_L shouldn't go high, if no CPU core voltage present.

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: L7211/31 was 1V when it was connected with the display. When I test board alone  L7211/31 are 0V

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: And you have high PLT_RST_L in such case???

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
I have connected back to the enclosure, Measured PLT_RST_L, It  is still going high (3.3V).
what does it mean?

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
Means the CPU core voltage is there; which is the voltage after 10s?

Just in case, try known good BIOS.

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: The core voltage is 0.903V after 10 sec. Could you help me with a known working bios?

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: Tried new bios which you have given, It didn't made any change

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: Additional info---> , After new bios , CPUCORE_SW1/SW2 are 0V, Also  PLT_RST_L  is low (0V)

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message: That is not normal; try again original BIOS.

threads.title: A1707 - EMC3162 No chime, No display
threads.message:
Good News z, Tried a new image attaching below ,,,, It is worked , Now its booting
